articles.title: Monkeypox likely spread by sex at 2 raves in Europe: Expert - India Today
articles.description: According to health officials, most of the known cases in Europe have been among men who have sex with men, but anyone can be infected through close contact with a sick person, their clothing or bedsheets.

articles.title: Monkeypox likely spread by sex at two raves in Europe: WHO adviser - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: “This is not COVID,” the former head of WHO’s emergencies department said. “We need to slow it down, but it does not spread in the air and we have vaccines to protect against it.”
articles.content:
To date, WHO has recorded more than 90 cases of monkeypox in a dozen countries including Canada, Spain, Israel, France, Switzerland, the US and Australia.

articles.title: Up to 67 monkeypox cases detected in EU countries as disease watchdog calls for vigilance - Independent.ie
articles.description: Public health authorities in EU countries, including Ireland, need to remain vigilant for cases of monkeypox with 67 infections now reported in the region, Europe’s disease watchdog warned today.
